DOC.brief_summary: The study analysis incidence contrast-induced nephropathy ( CIN ) patient previously normal renal function undergo angiography comparison three different treatment protocol renal function . Patients randomly assign three group : 1 ) peroral hydration , 2 ) Na bicarbonate ( NaHCO3 ) , 3 ) NaHCO3 plus N-acetylcysteine ( NAC ) infusion . Serum creatinine ( SCr ) , blood urea nitrogen ( BUN ) , neutrophil gelatinase-associated lipocalin ( NGAL ) measure 48 hour angiography . CIN define absolute increase 0.5 mg/dL relative increase > 25 % creatinine level 48-72 hour procedure
DOC.brief_title: A Prospective Study Incidence Prevention Contrast-induced Nephropathy Croatia
DOC.detailed_description: Patients randomly assign three group : 1 ) peroral hydration , 2 ) Na bicarbonate ( NaHCO3 ) , 3 ) NaHCO3 plus N-acetylcysteine ( NAC ) infusion The first group patient receive standard peroral hydration 1500 ml water day procedure . The second group receive 3 mL/kg/hour Na bicarbonate , hour prior angiography 1 mL/kg/hour , within six hour angiography . The third group receive parenteral NAC ( 1200 mg twice day ) one day angiography , day angiography , one day diagnostic procedure addition Na bicarbonate solution day angiography . The low-osmolar iodinated contrast agent use .
DOC.criteria: angina ( stable , unstable ) coronary artery disease cardiomyopathy valvular disease vasculitis peripheral arterial disease kidney dysfunction uncontrolled hypertension ( systolic blood pressure > 160 mm Hg and/or diastolic blood pressure > 100 mm Hg ) pregnancy lactation history allergic reaction contrast agent cardiogenic shock pulmonary edema multiple myeloma urgent coronary angiography receive contrast agent two day prior study 48 hour within study
